00040 #ifndef _light_h
00041 #define _light_h
00042 
00043 #include "attachable.h"
00044 #include "colourvalue.h"
00045 #include "crossplatformexport.h"
00046 #include "datatypes.h"
00047 #include "vector3.h"
00048 
00049 namespace Ogre
00050 {
00051     class Light;
00052 }
00053 
00054 namespace phys
00055 {
00056     class SceneManager;
00057     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00058     /// @class Light
00059     /// @headerfile light.h
00060     /// @brief This class is the class used for dynamic lighting within the scene.
00061     /// @details Dynamic lights come in 3 flavors: @n
00062     /// Directional - Used to simulate light from a very distant source.  Doesn't need a location, only
00063     /// a direction.  Light will hit all objects accordingly from that direction. @n
00064     /// Point - Used to simulate local light sources that emit light in all directions.  Doesn't need a
00065     /// direction, just a position. @n
00066     /// Spotlight - Used to simulate local light sources that emit light in one direction, such as a flashlight.
00067     /// Needs both a position and direction.  In addition needs values for falloff. @n
00068     /// Note: If attaching a light to a node, all transform information(position and orientation) becomes relative
00069     /// to the nodes transform.
00070     ///////////////////////////////////////
00071     class PHYS_LIB Light : public Attachable
00072     {
00073         public:
00074             enum LightType
00075             {
00076                 Directional,
00077                 Point,
00078                 Spotlight
00079             };
00080         protected:
00081             friend class Node;
00082             /// @brief The ogre light this class gets it's functionality from.
00083             Ogre::Light* OgreLight;
00084             /// @brief Pointer to the manager that created this class.
00085             SceneManager* Manager;
00086         public:
00087             /// @brief Standard initialization constructor.
00088             /// @param Name The name of this light.
00089             /// @param manager Pointer to the manager that this light is to be used in.
00090             Light(const String& Name, SceneManager* manager);
00091             /// @brief Internal Constructor
00092             /// @details This constructor should not be called on manually.
00093             /// @param light The Ogre light this class is based on.
00094             /// @param manager Pointer to the manager that this light is to be used in.
00095             Light(Ogre::Light* light, SceneManager* manager);
00096             /// @brief Class destructor.
00097             virtual ~Light();
00098             /// @brief Gets the name of this light.
00099             /// @return Returns a string containing the name given to this light.
00100             ConstString& GetName();
00101             /// @brief Sets the type of light this light is.
00102             /// @details The light types are listed with the class info.  Types are Directional, Point, and Spotlight.
00103             /// @param Type The enum value representing the type of light this is.
00104             void SetType(Light::LightType Type);
00105             /// @brief Sets the location from where the light will originate.
00106             /// @param Position A vector3 representing the location to set the light.
00107             void SetPosition(Vector3 Position);
00108             /// @brief Sets the direction the light will originate from.
00109             /// @param Direction A vector3 representing the direction the light will come from.
00110             void SetDirection(Vector3 Direction);
00111             /// @brief Sets the colour for the Diffuse light from this source.
00112             /// @details When rendering the final color of an object values of the colours of 3 types of lights are taken into account.
00113             /// The 3 types are: Diffuse, Specular, and Ambient.
00114             /// @param Red Real in the range of 0.0 to 1.0 determining the amount of red in the colour.
00115             /// @param Red green in the range of 0.0 to 1.0 determining the amount of green in the colour.
00116             /// @param Red blue in the range of 0.0 to 1.0 determining the amount of blue in the colour.
00117             void SetDiffuseColour(Real Red, Real Green, Real Blue);
00118             /// @brief Sets the colour for the Diffuse light from this source.
00119             /// @details This allows the setting of Diffuse color by a premade ColourValue.
00120             /// @param Colour ColourValue representing the color of the light to be set.
00121             void SetDiffuseColour(ColourValue &Colour);
00122             /// @brief Sets the colour for the Specular light from this source.
00123             /// @details When rendering the final color of an object values of the colours of 3 types of lights are taken into account.
00124             /// The 3 types are: Diffuse, Specular, and Ambient.
00125             /// @param Red Real in the range of 0.0 to 1.0 determining the amount of red in the colour.
00126             /// @param Red green in the range of 0.0 to 1.0 determining the amount of green in the colour.
00127             /// @param Red blue in the range of 0.0 to 1.0 determining the amount of blue in the colour.
00128             void SetSpecularColour(Real Red, Real Green, Real Blue);
00129             /// @brief Sets the colour for the Specular light from this source.
00130             /// @details This allows the setting of Specular color by a premade ColourValue.
00131             /// @param Colour ColourValue representing the color of the light to be set.
00132             void SetSpecularColour(ColourValue &Colour);
00133             /// @brief Sets the factors for the attenuation formula applied to this light.
00134             /// @details This function is only necessary when using a spotlight or point type of light.
00135             /// @param Range The absolute range of the light in world units.  Objects beyond this range will not be influenced by this light.
00136             /// @param Constant The constant of the attenuation, ranging from 0.0 to 1.0.  1.0 means never attenuate, 0.0 is complete attenuation.
00137             /// @param Linear The linear factor of the attentuation, ranging from 0.0 to 1.0.  1.0 means attenuate evenly over the distance.
00138             /// @param Quadratic The Quadratic factor of the attenuation.  This value adds curvature to the attenuation.
00139             void SetAttenuation(Real Range, Real Constant, Real Linear, Real Quadratic);
00140             /// @brief Defines the cone of light emitted by a spotlight.
00141             /// @details InnerAngle and OuterAngle should be input as Radians.
00142             /// @param InnerAngle Angle of the inner cone.
00143             /// @param OuterAngle Angle of the outer cone.
00144             /// @param Falloff The rate of falloff between the inner and outer cones.  1.0 means linear falloff.
00145             /// Less means slower falloff and higher means faster falloff.
00146             void SetSpotlightRange(Real InnerAngle, Real OuterAngle, Real Falloff=1.0);
00147             /// @brief Sets the Inner angle of the cone of light emitted by a spotlight.
00148             /// @param InnerAngle Angle of the inner cone.
00149             void SetSpotlightInnerAngle(Real InnerAngle);
00150             /// @brief Sets the Outer angle of the cone of light emitted by a spotlight.
00151             /// @param OuterAngle Angle of the outer cone.
00152             void SetSpotlightOuterAngle(Real OuterAngle);
00153             /// @brief Sets the rate of falloff of the cone of light emitted by a spotlight.
00154             /// @param Falloff The rate of falloff between the inner and outer cones.  1.0 means linear falloff.
00155             /// Less means slower falloff and higher means faster falloff.
00156             void SetSpotlightFalloff(Real Falloff);
00157             /// @brief Sets the lights power scale.
00158             /// @details The power scale of the light is a scaling factor indicating the relative power of the light.
00159             /// @param Power Real representing the factor by which to scale the power of the light.
00160             void SetPowerScale(Real Power);
00161             /// @brief Gets the type of light that this light is.
00162             /// @return Returns an enum value for this lights type.
00163             Light::LightType GetType();
00164             /// @brief Gets the current location of the light.
00165             /// @return Returns a vector3 representing the location of the light.
00166             Vector3 GetPosition();
00167             /// @brief Gets the currently set direction of the light.
00168             /// @return Returns a vector3 representing the set direction of the light.
00169             Vector3 GetDirection();
00170             /// @brief Gets the current colour of the diffuse light.
00171             /// @return Returns a colourvalue representing the currently set Diffuse light.
00172             ColourValue GetDiffuseColour();
00173             /// @brief Gets the current colour of the specular light.
00174             /// @return Returns a colourvalue representing the currently set Specular light.
00175             ColourValue GetSpecularColour();
00176             /// @brief Gets the absolute range of attenuation in world units.
00177             /// @return Returns a real representing the absolute range of attenuation.
00178             Real GetAttenuationRange();
00179             /// @brief Gets the constant factor of the attenuation.
00180             /// @return Returns a real representing the constant factor of attenuation.
00181             Real GetAttenuationConstant();
00182             /// @brief Gets the linear factor of the attentuation.
00183             /// @return Returns a real representing the linear factor of attenuation.
00184             Real GetAttenuationLinear();
00185             /// @brief Gets the quadric factor of the attenuation.
00186             /// @return Returns a real representing the quadric factor of attenuation.
00187             Real GetAttenuationQuadric();
00188             /// @brief Gets the Inner angle of the cone of light emitted by this spotlight.
00189             /// @return Returns a real representing the inner angle of this spotlight, in radians.
00190             Real GetSpotlightInnerAngle();
00191             /// @brief Gets the Outer angle of the cone of light emitted by this spotlight.
00192             /// @return Returns a real representing the outer angle of this spotlight, in radians.
00193             Real GetSpotlightOuterAngle();
00194             /// @brief Gets the rate of falloff of the cone of light emitted by this spotlight.
00195             /// @return Returns a real representing the falloff of the cone of light.
00196             Real GetSpotlightFalloff();
00197             /// @brief Gets the lights power scale.
00198             /// @return Returns a real representing the power scale of the light.
00199             Real GetPowerScale();
00200     };
00201 }//phys
00202 
00203 #endif
